column5: This I found very cool. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KdoUcBu4kbg  Any of the older generation know these spots?
Wow, the way they dressed back then, you wouldn't know if they were going fishing or going to church!  Pretty neat old photos!
Thats awesome misfish  I love the "sundays best" garb some of them are sporting while fishing. Shirts and ties, fancy hats, suspenders.
I believe there are ones here that would say, they were LADYS back then.
Very cool... thanks for posting! HH

Great find!!  I love old photographs....these were pretty cool to see.  I noticed that none of the boats had motors....how archaic is that?? LOL.  Maybe I just need a rowboat...back to the classified ads...hehe.
This one got to me. I remember when .  Well not that far back but it was pretty close.
I think the one spot they were fishing was the toronto sportsman show trout pond

Very cool Brian..thanks for posting.  Almost makes me want to wear a dress fishing..almost lol  In a few of the pictures the locations are mentioned.....Centre Island, Hanlna's PT, the Don River....very cool!
very cool pics, thanks for sharing
Neat...I guess back them they had wicker baskets rather than white buckets for everyone to get p-o'ed about
Both of those were AWESOME. When life was a little simpler.... Not one of them had a Blackberry  Thanks for posting.   Hookset.
The very first one, I believe I saw a relative of GCD, it was the picture of all the men sitting down, the guy in the far back left corner,,,only one without a shirt...
